A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Everything is wrong within this two and an half hour mess.
Supposedly epic scenes ruined by jokes\, a truly offensive offscreen death\, an incoherent and inconsistent plot\, and badly developed characters combine together to give you\, the viewer\, one of the worst Star Wars experiences of your entire life.

And this is just the tip of the iceberg.
Well developed characters who act coherently to their background\, like Poe Dameron\, are almost demonized with any reason at all. Promising and interesting secondary characters like Tallie Lintra and Captain Moden Canady are -little spoiler (?)- just killed after a bunch of seconds onscreen to leave room for such a boring subplot (the one involving Finn) you'd hope to have a remote controller to just skip it all.

A sidenote: Star Wars setting is not supposed to be politically correct\, inconsistent\, and most of all so lacking of coherence even with the last Episode. 

This movie is a disgrace.
